name: El Presidente
instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled.
description: The El Presidente earned its acclaim in Havana during the 1920s through the 1940s during the American Prohibition. It quickly became the preferred drink of the Cuban upper class.

ingredients.name: White Rum
ingredients.description: White rum, also known as light or silver rum, is a type of rum that is clear and colorless. It is often unaged or aged for a very short period in stainless steel or other neutral containers, which prevents it from developing the color and flavor that result from prolonged aging in wooden barrels.

ingredients.name: Dry Vermouth
ingredients.description: Dry Vermouth is a type of fortified wine that is aromatized with various botanicals, including herbs, spices, and sometimes citrus peels. It is characterized by its dry and less sweet profile compared to sweet vermouth. Dry Vermouth is a key ingredient in classic cocktails such as the Martini and the Manhattan, where it adds complexity and a subtle herbal note to the drink. It is typically white or pale yellow in color and is often enjoyed as a chilled aperitif on its own. The alcohol content of Dry Vermouth is fortified with additional spirits, usually grape brandy, which also contributes to its flavor and preservation.

substitutes.name: Lillet Blanc
substitutes.description: Lillet Blanc is a French aperitif wine that falls under the category of aromatized wines. It is crafted from a blend of white wine and citrus liqueurs, primarily made from sweet oranges from Spain and bitter green oranges from Morocco. Lillet Blanc is known for its light and floral profile, with hints of citrus, honey, and a subtle bitterness.

ingredients.name: Orange Curaçao
ingredients.description: Liqueur flavored with the dried peel of the bitter orange laraha, a citrus fruit grown on the Dutch island of Curaçao. Curaçao is used by liqueur makers overt the world as a generic name for orange-flavoured liqueurs.

ingredients.name: Grenadine Syrup
ingredients.description: Grenadine syrup is a sweet, vibrant red syrup made from pomegranate juice, sugar, and water, often used as a flavoring and coloring agent in cocktails. Traditionally, grenadine derives its name from the French word "grenade," meaning pomegranate, highlighting its original base ingredient. The syrup is known for its balanced flavor, combining the sweetness of sugar with the tartness of pomegranate, which adds a fruity complexity to drinks.
